questions.question: Will water eject damage my speakers?
questions.answer: No, the water eject sound waves are completely safe and won't damage your speakers. It's the same as playing music on your phone, but with carefully calibrated frequencies designed specifically for water removal.

questions.question: Does water eject work on all devices?
questions.answer: Clear Wave water eject works on iPhone and iPad devices. The app is optimized for iOS and provides the best water removal results on Apple hardware. It requires iOS 15.1 or later.

questions.question: How to eject water from iPhone speakers - how long does it take?
questions.answer: Learning how to eject water from iPhone speakers is simple - usually 10-30 seconds is enough for water ejection, but you can repeat the process if needed. You can test your speaker volume after each cycle to check if the water has been removed.

questions.question: What if water eject doesn't work immediately?
questions.answer: If water eject doesn't work immediately, try repeating the process 2-3 times. For stubborn water, you can also try the frequency tone generator at different frequencies. If the problem persists, it might indicate hardware damage that requires professional repair.

questions.question: Is the water eject app free to use?
questions.answer: Clear Wave water eject is free to download with basic water removal features. Premium features like the advanced tone generator are available through in-app purchases for power users.

questions.question: Can I use this for other audio testing besides water eject?
questions.answer: Yes! Clear Wave includes professional audio tools for testing hearing, tuning audio gear, monitoring noise levels, and checking stereo channel balance - making it an all-in-one audio toolkit beyond just water ejection.
